Hello, I'm Yulia Pimonova

I'm

Cheminformatics Expert & ML Researcher · New Mexico, USA

Get in Touch Download CV

About Me

I’m a computational chemist and machine learning researcher with more than six years of experience developing scalable ML frameworks and high‑performance simulation pipelines for molecular science. I specialize in Python, PyTorch and scientific computing and have a proven track record of deploying meta‑learning algorithms, cheminformatics tools and open‑source packages.

My work has resulted in successful cross‑disciplinary collaborations, significant funding awards and publications in top‑tier journals. I’m passionate about bridging chemistry and machine learning to solve complex problems and mentoring the next generation of scientists.

Technical Skills

Programming & ML

Python (advanced), PyTorch, Scikit‑learn, XGBoost, Graph Neural Networks, Model‑Agnostic Meta‑Learning (MAML), Meta‑Learning

Scientific Computing

NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, HOOMD‑blue, LAMMPS, Molecular Dynamics, Density Functional Theory (DFT)

Tools & Infrastructure

Git, CI/CD, SLURM, High‑Performance Computing (HPC), Linux/Unix, Jupyter, LaTeX, AWS basics, Open‑source development

Professional Experience

Postdoctoral Research Associate
Los Alamos National Laboratory · May 2024 – Present · Los Alamos, NM
  • Developed a meta‑learning framework for molecular property prediction that outperforms conventional models on small data; methodology adopted across three LANL divisions (bio, environmental, seismology) and currently under review at Nature Machine Intelligence.
  • Built buhito, an open‑source Python package for graphlet analysis, implementing optimized DFS/BFS algorithms; secured $500K+ in funding as the sole postdoc on a multi‑PI computational chemistry project.
  • Contributed core cheminformatics functionality to the minervachem library for the SeparationML project, developing automated filtering pipelines and substructure visualisation tools for metal‑metal separation ligand design.
  • Mentored two graduate students from statistics and computer science backgrounds in 2025 with a 100% project acceptance rate at the Applied ML Summer School; expanding mentorship to three students in 2026.
  • Organised the Telluride Workshop on ML for Chemistry (40+ participants), managing invitations, scheduling and facilitating discussions; received outstanding feedback on the pre‑workshop survey methodology.
Graduate Research Assistant, PhD Student
University of Utah, Department of Chemistry · May 2020 – May 2024 · Salt Lake City, UT
  • Engineered a custom molecular dynamics simulation pipeline processing over 500K‑particle cocrystallisation systems on GPU‑accelerated HPC clusters using HOOMD‑blue, generating more than 10 TB of data for machine‑learning analysis.
  • Published a first‑author paper in JACS demonstrating that thermodynamic stability is a poor predictor of cocrystal formation, challenging conventional pharmaceutical approaches.
  • Automated analysis workflows combining NumPy, Pandas and Freud to extract thermodynamic and kinetic parameters from terabyte‑scale simulation data, reducing analysis time by 70%.
  • Developed object‑oriented Python packages for molecular visualisation adopted by five lab members, reducing code duplication by 50%.

Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry
University of Utah · Aug 2019 – May 2024 · GPA 3.98/4.0 · Summa Cum Laude

Department of Chemistry, University of Utah, Salt Lake City, UT

B.Sc. in Chemistry
Southern Federal University · Sep 2014 – Jun 2019 · GPA 4.0/4.0 · Summa Cum Laude

Rostov‑on‑Don, Russia

    Pimonova, Y., Carpenter, J.E., Gruenwald, M., J. Am. Chem. Soc., 2024, 146(4), 2815–2824.

    Datta, S., Pimonova, Y. et al., arXiv:2509.18349, 2026.
